field.name: summary
field.value: AspView: sections of nested view component are not recognized

field.name: description
field.value:
[Similar to http://support.castleproject.org/browse/CONTRIB-80]
<component:CaptureFor id="whatever"> <component:SomeComponentWithSections> <section:header>...</section:header> <section:footer>...</section:footer> ... </component:SomeComponentWithSections> </component>
The sections are not recognized in SomeComponentWithSections (HasSections returns false for any of the sections)
Similarly, nesting a component with sections within another component that has sections confuses the parser such that it emits some of the <component> and <section> tags.
I consider this bug critical as components should be arbitrarily nestable.
[see attached testcase patch]

comment.author: a.loker
comment.text: I updated the patch to the current trunk version.

comment.author: a.loker
comment.text:
The bug appears in two situations: a)A component nested in the body of another component <component:X> body body body <component:Y>...</component:Y> body body body </component:X>
b) Nested component having a section with the same name of it's parent component in case the nested component is not nested within the section with that name: <component:X> <section:A>...</section:A> ... <component:Y> <section:A>...</section:A> </component:Y> </component:X>
